page.title: 16MARFORD PAST & PRESENT
page.content: Although only a small part of Marford is included in our GRID we thought it would be valuable to mention why the village was built in the first place. "It was built for a purpose_to house the estate workers and tenants of the local'Halls'.Each member of the village was a craftsman/professional man;the gardener,the inn or shopkeeper the smith or doctor.However the functional Marford no longer exists.It is now a dormitary village where businessmen ,teachers and pensioners reside. ...the Marford houses show ingenuity and skill both in their architecture and distribution far above the intelligence of an average craftsman. (Taken from {MARFORD:A Clwyd Village } by Joanne Horton_a pupil of The Queen's School Chester; 'A' Level Project 1979.
